explanations.git init: Initializes a new Git repository in the current directory.
explanations.git clone: Creates a local copy of a remote repository.
explanations.git add: Stages changes for the next commit (e.g., 'git add .' to stage all files).
explanations.git commit: Saves staged changes with a commit message (e.g., 'git commit -m "Initial commit"').
explanations.git push: Uploads local commits to a remote repository (e.g., 'git push origin main').
explanations.git pull: Fetches and merges changes from a remote repository (e.g., 'git pull origin main').
explanations.git branch: Lists, creates, or deletes branches (e.g., 'git branch feature-branch').
explanations.git checkout: Switches to a different branch or commit (e.g., 'git checkout main').
explanations.git switch: Switches branches in a simpler way than 'checkout' (e.g., 'git switch main').
explanations.git merge: Merges changes from one branch into another (e.g., 'git merge feature-branch').
explanations.git rebase: Moves or combines commits from one branch onto another (e.g., 'git rebase main').
explanations.git status: Displays the state of the working directory and staging area.
explanations.git log: Shows commit history (e.g., 'git log --oneline' for a condensed view).
explanations.git diff: Shows changes between commits, branches, or files (e.g., 'git diff HEAD').
explanations.git reset: Resets the current branch to a previous commit (e.g., 'git reset --hard HEAD~1').
explanations.git revert: Creates a new commit that undoes a previous commit without changing history.
explanations.git stash: Temporarily saves changes without committing them (e.g., 'git stash save "message"').
explanations.git tag: Creates or lists tags for marking specific commits (e.g., 'git tag v1.0').
explanations.git remote: Manages remote repository connections (e.g., 'git remote -v' to list remotes).
explanations.git fetch: Downloads changes from a remote repository but doesn't merge them.
explanations.git cherry-pick: Applies a specific commit from one branch to another (e.g., 'git cherry-pick <commit-hash>').
explanations.git reflog: Shows a history of all recent HEAD movements.
explanations.git bisect: Finds a commit that introduced a bug by performing a binary search.
explanations.git show: Displays detailed information about a commit or object.
explanations.git config: Configures Git settings like user name and email (e.g., 'git config --global user.name "John Doe"').
explanations.git blame: Shows who last modified each line of a file and when.
